title: Keen 4 Manual
content:
So I was tidying up my room a bit and found something in a drawer. Didn't know if anyone would want scans of it, but here are some very shrunk and compressed scans. Does anyone want full scans? (If so, what image format, size, etc?)
[img]http://keen.keenx.com/gfx/temp/keen4_manual_1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://keen.keenx.com/gfx/temp/keen4_manual_2.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Keen 4 Manual
content:
I can't find them at CC314 (where I thought I downloaded them from, I guess I'm wrong), but there are already some scans hosted somewhere.
Then again, maybe it was a temporary situation.
Either way, those scans are about 800 x 600 px in size (2 pages scanned at once, except for page 1/title).Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen 4 Manual
content:
Go ahead, I'd say. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:

title: Re: Keen 4 Manual
content: That's weird.  I have the full versions of all Keen games except Keen Dreams and the only manual that I got was a black and white manual for Keen 6.

title: Re: Keen 4 Manual
content:
It depends when you bought the game, because that manual was sent with the game when the electronic hint sheet didn't exist yet (GGHINT.EXE & CKHINT.EXE). Also if you bought the game when it came out it could have been that the manual which is actually referred to as a "hint sheet" by Apogee was not ready yet.

I'd really like to see a scan of this! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]
